meanings.definition: Thin or skinny in a way that is unattractive or unappealing.
meanings.sent1: The scrawnier cat struggled to catch the mouse.
meanings.sent2: She felt self-conscious about her scrawnier arms.
meanings.sent3: The scrawnier scarecrow was blown away by the wind.
meanings.sent4: His scrawnier frame seemed to disappear in the crowd.
meanings.sent5: The scrawnier branches of the tree swayed in the breeze.

meanings.definition: Comparative form of scrawny, meaning even thinner or skinnier than before.
meanings.sent1: The scrawnier puppy was the runt of the litter.
meanings.sent2: After being sick, he looked even scrawnier than usual.
meanings.sent3: The scrawnier pencil broke easily under pressure.
meanings.sent4: Her scrawnier voice barely carried across the room.
meanings.sent5: The scrawnier thread snapped with a gentle tug.
